intro: Siderodendron laxiflorum, commonly known as the broad-flowered ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves and produces showy, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
